summary: It's Only a Paper Moon - DaydreamingSophia - A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin [Archive of Our Own]
title: It's Only a Paper Moon - DaydreamingSophia - A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 4/?
Fandom: A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, Game of Thrones (TV)
Rating: Explicit
Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
Relationships: Sandor Clegane/Sansa Stark, Sandor Clegane & Sansa Stark
Characters: Sansa Stark, Sandor Clegane, Margaery Tyrell, Bronn (ASoIaF), Arya Stark, Catelyn Tully Stark, Ned Stark, Harrold Hardyng, Original Characters, Myranda Royce, Loras Tyrell, Robb Stark
Additional Tags: Post-World War II, 1940s, Alternate Universe, Painting, Boxing, New York City, Slow Burn, POV Sansa Stark, Eventual Sandor Clegane/Sansa Stark, Modern Era, Fluffy Cat, Eventual Smut, Hurt/Comfort, Romance
Summary:

1940s-1950s AU

In New York City, cabs and cars fly through the streets like pixies searching for hidden lovers. The War has ended and a new life of luxury and endless possibilities infects those who find themselves in the year 1949. We have a painter, Sansa Stark, who through her friend Margaery, strikes up a commission for a portrait of the world’s current Heavyweight Champion, The Hound.

Chapter 4 is up and running!

summary: A Connection Between Sansa and Arya's Alias' and Lady Stoneheart
title: A Connection Between Sansa and Arya's Alias' and Lady Stoneheart
body:
It’s been pointed out before that Arya’s alias Cat of the Canals and Sansa’s alias Alayne Stone combined is Cat-Alayne, forming their mother’s name, Catelyn. I recently noticed another connection Sansa and Arya’s alias’ have to Catelyn name, or rather Lady Stoneheart’s.

Sansa’s alias in the Vale is Alayne Stone and the resurrected vengeful Catelyn is known as Lady Stoneheart.

Another name Lady Stoneheart is known as is Mother Merciless and we later see Arya take the name Mercy.

title: 6SS: SanSan: Dessert
body:
Sandor was reading the newspaper when Sansa skipped into the kitchen, he didn’t pay her any attention, he just continued to gulp his coffee and reading.

“This is a good day for some ice cream and cookies,” Sansa singsonged, “Today’s a fantastic day for dessert for breakfast!”

“Sansa, you are not eating dessert for breakfast,” Sandor said, “You need proper food.”

“Sandor, dear, it’s Sunday, I don’t care, I’m having dessert for breakfast and you cannot stop me, but if you try, I’m warning you, you’ll be sleeping in our guest bedroom for a week.”

“…Fine, do what you want.”

“That’s what I thought!”

“Sansa, you are not eating dessert for breakfast,” Sandor said, “You need proper food.”

“Sandor, dear, it’s Sunday, I don’t care, I’m having dessert for breakfast and you cannot stop me, but if you try, I’m warning you, you’ll be sleeping in our guest bedroom for a week.”

“…Fine, do what you want.”

“That’s what I thought!”

summary: I am trying to find a sansan fic. I thought you might be able to help. It's a modern au where Sansa is back home after being in...
question: I am trying to find a sansan fic. I thought you might be able to help. It's a modern au where Sansa is back home after being in an abusive relationship with Joffrey. She has been greatly affected by the relationship. She doesn't even like to leave her house anymore. Ned takes her fishing to get her out of the house, and he goes with his friend, Sandor. Sandor is currently working on remodeling the Stark's home (I forget exactly what he is working on). He tries to help Sansa. It was unfinished.

summary:
"True knights." The queen seemed to find that wonderfully amusing. "No 
doubt you're right. So why don't you just eat your broth...
body:
“True knights.” The queen seemed to find that wonderfully amusing. “No doubt you’re right. So why don’t you just eat your broth like a good girl and wait for Symeon Star-Eyes and Prince Aemon the Dragonknight to come rescue you, sweetling. I’m sure it won’t be very long now.”     (ACOK, Sansa V)

Is this kidnap plot foreshadowing?

blog.name: stormcloudrising
blog.title: Storm Cloud Rising
blog.description: Theories and analysis of my favorite shows, books, life and anything of interest

summary: House Stark - The Lone Wolf Dies but the Pack Survives
title: House Stark - The Lone Wolf Dies but the Pack Survives
body:
March 11, 2019

Arya bit her lip. “What will Bran do when he’s of age?”

Ned knelt beside her. “He has years to find that answer, Arya. For now, it is enough to know that he will live.” The night the bird had come from Winterfell, Eddard Stark had taken the girls to the castle godswood, an acre of elm and alder and black cottonwood overlooking the river. The heart tree there was a great oak, its ancient limbs overgrown with smokeberry vines; they knelt before it to offer their thanksgiving, as if it had been a weirwood. Sansa drifted to sleep as the moon rose, Arya several hours later, curling up in the grass under Ned’s cloak. All through the dark hours he kept his vigil alone. When dawn broke over the city, the dark red blooms of dragon’s breath surrounded the girls where they lay. “I dreamed of Bran," Sansa had whispered to him. "I saw him smiling.”

“He was going to be a knight,” Arya was saying now. “A knight of the Kingsguard. Can he still be a knight?”

A Game of Thrones - Eddard V

I’ve always loved the feeling of the pack in this scene but with Ned standing vigil over his kids, it’s also jam packed with a lot of Long Night Symbolism, which has always made me worry about Arya and Bran.

It’s interesting that Sansa is the one to fall asleep first as the moon rose but Arya stays awake long into the night.  Then Sansa awakes with the dawn.  This makes sense as she went to sleep the earliest but it could also be symbolic of her dying during the Long Night and then in some way returning with the Dawn—an idea I speculated about here.  

George also references Arya curling up under Ned’s cloak, which symbolically suggests a shroud.  We know that Arya will be one of the warriors fighting for the dawn and so her staying awake” long into the night” is symbolic of that possibility. However, the fact that she is not mentioned as waking with the dawn does have me a bit worried.  

Nonetheless, all hope is not lost because the dragon’s breath is protectively surrounding the girls.  I’ve seen some speculate that the dragon’s breath is about a threat to House Stark and that is certainly a possibility.  However, in this instance, I don’t think that is the case.  This passage is about the pack and the dragon’s breath symbolize Jon and is a tip to his identity.   It’s one of the passages that looking back you can recognize as a clue Martin dropped to Jon’s true identity.  And the wolf dragon will protect his sister/cousins.  This gives me hope for Arya’s survival.

The youngest Stark daughter worries about her younger brother whose dream was to be a knight of the Kingsguard.  As he can no longer walk, that particular dream is beyond his reach but the Kingsguard turned out not to be the honorable institution the populace believe it to be. However, the fact that he can no longer walk does not mean that his dream won’t be fulfilled. He won’t be a member of the Kingsguard but he will be something possibly even better—a knight of the trees. And in this role, he will protect his family and the realm.

I like to think that Sansa’s dream is of him at the end after the battle is won. Maybe the dream will even be about his smiling face sculptured into the the trees.

He won’t be a member of the Kingsguard but he will be something possibly even better—a knight of the trees. And in this role, he will protect his family and the realm.

I like to think that Sansa’s dream is of him at the end after the battle is won. Maybe the dream will even be about his smiling face sculptured into the the trees.
trail.content:
March 11, 2019

Arya bit her lip. “What will Bran do when he’s of age?”

Ned knelt beside her. “He has years to find that answer, Arya. For now, it is enough to know that he will live.” The night the bird had come from Winterfell, Eddard Stark had taken the girls to the castle godswood, an acre of elm and alder and black cottonwood overlooking the river. The heart tree there was a great oak, its ancient limbs overgrown with smokeberry vines; they knelt before it to offer their thanksgiving, as if it had been a weirwood. Sansa drifted to sleep as the moon rose, Arya several hours later, curling up in the grass under Ned’s cloak. All through the dark hours he kept his vigil alone. When dawn broke over the city, the dark red blooms of dragon’s breath surrounded the girls where they lay. “I dreamed of Bran," Sansa had whispered to him. "I saw him smiling.”

“He was going to be a knight,” Arya was saying now. “A knight of the Kingsguard. Can he still be a knight?”

A Game of Thrones - Eddard V

I’ve always loved the feeling of the pack in this scene but with Ned standing vigil over his kids, it’s also jam packed with a lot of Long Night Symbolism, which has always made me worry about Arya and Bran.

It’s interesting that Sansa is the one to fall asleep first as the moon rose but Arya stays awake long into the night.  Then Sansa awakes with the dawn.  This makes sense as she went to sleep the earliest but it could also be symbolic of her dying during the Long Night and then in some way returning with the Dawn—an idea I speculated about here.  

George also references Arya curling up under Ned’s cloak, which symbolically suggests a shroud.  We know that Arya will be one of the warriors fighting for the dawn and so her staying awake” long into the night” is symbolic of that possibility. However, the fact that she is not mentioned as waking with the dawn does have me a bit worried.  

Nonetheless, all hope is not lost because the dragon’s breath is protectively surrounding the girls.  I’ve seen some speculate that the dragon’s breath is about a threat to House Stark and that is certainly a possibility.  However, in this instance, I don’t think that is the case.  This passage is about the pack and the dragon’s breath symbolize Jon and is a tip to his identity.   It’s one of the passages that looking back you can recognize as a clue Martin dropped to Jon’s true identity.  And the wolf dragon will protect his sister/cousins.  This gives me hope for Arya’s survival.

The youngest Stark daughter worries about her younger brother whose dream was to be a knight of the Kingsguard.  As he can no longer walk, that particular dream is beyond his reach but the Kingsguard turned out not to be the honorable institution the populace believe it to be. However, the fact that he can no longer walk does not mean that his dream won’t be fulfilled. He won’t be a member of the Kingsguard but he will be something possibly even better—a knight of the trees. And in this role, he will protect his family and the realm.

I like to think that Sansa’s dream is of him at the end after the battle is won. Maybe the dream will even be about his smiling face sculptured into the the trees.

blog.name: thequeenofhades
blog.title: "...then I wake up, like a thief of dreams."
blog.description: Elizabeth. 33. Writer. We are stardust my darling, we have galaxies in our hearts.

title: 6SS: SanSan: Witches III
body:
“You know I cannot do that Sandor,” Sansa’s voice was full of grief, “I know you miss your sister, and want to talk to her, but… disturbing the peace of the dead is not something I wish to do, so please, don’t ask that of me.”

Sandor looked at his girlfriend, her eyes were sad and he wanted to be angry at her, but he found that he couldn’t, after all, he was asking an almost impossible, “I just hoped, I don’t know… when you said that you were a witch, I - I just thought that you could, I’ve seen you do incredible things,” Sandor’s voice cracked, “And I just wanted to talk to my sister one more time.”

Sansa’s hand found his, “I know my love, but, I have always felt that the dead deserve their peace; summoning someone’s soul, if only for a moment is not something I can do,” her voice dropped to an almost whisper, “And even if I could, I wouldn’t, I’m sorry, not even for you.”

Sandor looked down at their hands and sighed, “I know Little bird, I was asking too much, forgive me.”

“There is nothing to forgive,” Sansa said, “Perhaps if I told you some stories, you’d understand my reasoning, would you hear them?”

“Aye, I would,” Sandor replied, “I’d like to know whatever you can tell me, Little bird.”

summary: I like how we, as a Jonsa fandom, are collectively having a breakdown pre season 8.
body:
I like how we, as a Jonsa fandom, are collectively having a breakdown pre season 8.

Still, drink water, Jonsa fam, stay hydrated, read all the smut, watch all the fanvids, and remember to platonically stare at your siblings’ lips after tenderly kissing them on the forehead for 4.5 seconds.
